context:
The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) is a three-year diploma to bachelor's degree program offered at an Ontario college. Graduates of Construction Engineering Technology diploma programs may enter the third year of this degree program upon completion of bridge courses. The curriculum combines theory, applied research, field study, and hands-on practical education in both construction engineering and technology as well as business and management methods.

The degree program requires a mandatory field experience semester during the spring/summer of the third year. Students must complete a minimum of 450 hours of appropriate field experience or its equivalent in the field of construction management. The field experience is facilitated through the Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management and the Centre for Construction and Engineering Technologies Industry Liaison Office.

The program is recognized by the construction industry and accredited by the Canadian Institute of Quantity Surveyors (CIQS). Graduates are entitled to the academic credential designation of Hons. B.Tech (Construction Management) and may qualify for Gold Seal Certification (GSC) offered by the Canadian Construction Association. The program duration is not specified in the text, but it can be assumed that the bachelor's degree takes an additional year beyond the three-year diploma.

There is no information about contact details or emails mentioned in the text.
question:
Title: Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) Degree Program at Ontario Colleges

The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) is a degree program offered at Ontario colleges for students who have completed a Construction Engineering Technology diploma or its equivalent. This three-year program combines theoretical knowledge, applied research, field study, and hands-on practical education in both construction engineering and technology as well as business and management methods.

To enter the third year of this degree program, graduates of Construction Engineering Technology diplomas must complete bridge courses. The curriculum emphasizes construction engineering and technology, along with business and management aspects, to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the industry.

A mandatory field experience semester during the spring/summer of the third year is required, where students must complete a minimum of 450 hours of appropriate field experience or its equivalent in the field of construction management. The Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management and the Centre for Construction and Engineering Technologies Industry Liaison Office facilitate this field experience.

This degree program is recognized by the construction industry and accredited by the Canadian Institute of Quantity Surveyors (CIQS). Upon graduation, students receive the academic credential designation of Hons. B.Tech (Construction Management) and may qualify for Gold Seal Certification (GSC) offered by the Canadian Construction Association.

Unfortunately, no contact details or email addresses were provided in the text. For more information, potential applicants are encouraged to visit the Ontario colleges' websites or contact them directly.?

context:
The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) program at the college prepares graduates for careers in various roles within the construction industry. Some possible career options include construction manager, project manager, project coordinator, field engineer, site superintendent, estimator, project monitor, building science specialist, building condition assessor, construction sales manager, construction claims specialist, construction quality control specialist, construction health and safety specialist, construction cost consultant, developer, project controls specialist, site inspector, contractor, and subcontractor.

Construction managers are required to have specialized skills to succeed in this industry, which is rapidly changing and growing. They need a comprehensive knowledge of construction safety and quality management systems and sustainable construction practices. The program is fully accredited by the Canadian Institute of Quantity Surveyors (CIQS), the Chartered Institute of Building (CIOB), and the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS). Graduates are qualified to obtain professional memberships in various construction management associations, such as CIQS, which offers Professional Quantity Surveyors (PQS) or Construction Estimator Certified (CEC) designations. The Gold Seal Certification (GSC) is also available for graduates.
question:
It seems like you're describing the Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) program offered at a specific college, but you didn't mention which one. I can provide some general information about construction management programs and careers based on your description.

Construction management is a professional discipline that deals with the planning, coordination, and execution of construction projects from inception to completion. Construction managers oversee various aspects of a project, including budgeting, scheduling, quality control, safety, and communication between the various stakeholders involved. They may work for general contractors, construction management firms, architectural or engineering consulting firms, or government agencies.

The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) program you mentioned is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the construction industry and the skills necessary to succeed in various roles within it. Graduates may pursue careers as construction managers, project managers, estimators, site supervisors, health and safety specialists, quality control inspectors, and many other positions related to the construction industry.

The program's accreditation by professional organizations such as CIQS, CIOB, and RICS demonstrates its commitment to providing students with a high-quality education that meets industry standards. Graduates may also be eligible for professional certifications or memberships in these organizations, which can help them advance their careers.

Construction management is an exciting and rewarding field that offers many opportunities for those interested in building and infrastructure projects. If you have any specific questions about a particular construction management program or career path, feel free to ask!?

context: The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) degree is offered at George Brown College and is well respected in the construction sector. The Gold Seal Certification, which is available for superintendents, foremen, estimators, project managers, owner’s construction managers, and safety practitioners, is based on a candidate’s education, training, and professional work experience. The construction industry is the largest employer in the Greater Toronto Area and there is a need for improved and advanced education and training in the sector. Some industry leaders believe that the four-year degree program in Construction Management at George Brown College is an important component to ensure the continual requirement for construction professionals will be met. Leading construction executives identified the science of construction and management as the two most important elements in the construction industry. The introduction of this program was described as the next stage of development of professionalism in the industry. Some quotes from industry leaders in support of the program include those from Temple Harris, vice-chairman, Gillam Group; Christopher Rick, PCL Constructors, Canada Inc.; James Zippel, general manager, Electrical Service & Projects, Ainsworth; and Michael George, president, Trisura Insurance.

context:
Program Learning Outcomes:
- Use relevant media to communicate construction project information
- Analyze past construction project performance to improve future projects
- Manage construction projects in a compliant, safe, ethical and sustainable manner
- Apply management tools and techniques to execute construction projects on time and within budget
- Recognize and value diversity of opinions, processes and approaches in construction projects
- Incorporate effective leadership strategies to develop high-functioning teams
- Analyze technical problems in construction projects and develop solutions
- Apply business, accounting and financial principles to manage construction project costs
- Evaluate potential risks impacting construction projects and devise risk-mitigation strategies
- Create technical documents relevant to design, procurement and execution of construction projects
- Behave ethically and responsibly consistent with professional codes of conduct, laws, policies and contracts

Courses offered:
- BLDG 4050: Sustainable Construction
- Capstone 2 – Industry Research (no course number mentioned)
- MGMT 4052: Project Financial Monitoring
- MGMT 4090: Construction Project Procurement 2
- MGMT 4091: Leadership and Ethics for Construction Managers

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $9,564.00
- International Tuition: $20,465.00

Additional information:
- Field experience semester requires an additional field experience fee
- Contact 416-415-5000, ext. 6297 or email construction\_degree@georgebrown.ca for more details
- George Brown College students with a GPA of 3.0 or higher from Construction Engineering Technology program (T105) or comparable programs at other Ontario colleges may be eligible to enter the degree completion pathway.
question:
Program Name: Bachelor of Science in Construction Management - Degree Completion Pathway
Institution: George Brown College
Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
Duration: 2 years (full-time)
Program Overview:
This two-year degree completion pathway is designed for students with a diploma or advanced diploma in construction technology or related fields. The program focuses on the management aspects of the construction industry and covers areas such as sustainable construction, project financial monitoring, construction project procurement, leadership and ethics, and risk management.

Learning Outcomes:
- Use relevant media to communicate construction project information
- Analyze past construction project performance to improve future projects
- Manage construction projects in a compliant, safe, ethical and sustainable manner
- Apply management tools and techniques to execute construction projects on time and within budget
- Recognize and value diversity of opinions, processes and approaches in construction projects
- Incorporate effective leadership strategies to develop high-functioning teams
- Analyze technical problems in construction projects and develop solutions
- Apply business, accounting and financial principles to manage construction project costs
- Evaluate potential risks impacting construction projects and devise risk-mitigation strategies
- Create technical documents relevant to design, procurement and execution of construction projects
- Behave ethically and responsibly consistent with professional codes of conduct, laws, policies and contracts

Courses offered:
- BLDG 4050: Sustainable Construction (same as above)
- Capstone 2 – Industry Research (no course number mentioned in the description provided)
- MGMT 4052: Project Financial Monitoring
- MGMT 4090: Construction Project Procurement 2
- MGMT 4091: Leadership and Ethics for Construction Managers

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $37,136.00 (for the entire 2-year program)
- International Tuition: $85,840.00 (for the entire 2-year program)

Additional information:
- Students may be eligible for transfer credits from their previous education
- Contact 416-415-5000, ext. 6297 or email construction\_degree@georgebrown.ca for more details
- Upon completion of the program, students will receive a Bachelor of Science in Construction Management degree from George Brown College.?

question:
Title: Construction Engineering Technology to Construction Project Management Applied Degree Program Fees and Requirements

Overview:
The following information provides details on the tuition fees, financial assistance, admission requirements, and special requirements for the Construction Engineering Technology to Construction Project Management Applied Degree program offered at XYZ College.

Tuition Fees:
* Fall 2021 start: $6,385.00 per semester for a total of $12,770.00 for two semesters
* Winter 2022 start: $6,429.00 per semester for a total of $12,858.00 for two semesters
* Programs starting in Fall 2022 and Spring 2024: Tuition fees are subject to board approval, while material, student service, and ancillary fees are estimated at 465.00 for the first two semesters.
* Amounts listed for programs starting in Fall 2023 and later dates are subject to change.

Financial Assistance:
* This program is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet OSAP eligibility criteria.

Admission Requirements:
* Only graduates of an Ontario College Advanced (three-year) diploma in Construction Engineering technology with a GPA of 3.0 or higher are considered for the program.
* The program has been granted a consent by the Ministry of Colleges and Universities to offer this applied degree for a seven-year term starting May 7, 2018.

Special Requirements:
* Students need to own or purchase a laptop and arrange for home Internet service with 25 to 40 Mbps and a ping time of 20–100 ms. The laptop specifications should meet or exceed the following specifications: operating system - Windows 10 Home 64-bit English, processor - 9th Generation Intel Core i7-9750H (12MB Cache, up to 4.5 GHz, 6 cores), memory (RAM) - 16GB (2x8GB DDR4 2666MHz), disk space - 256GB M.2 PCIe NVMe Solid State Drive (Boot) + 1TB 5400 rpm 2.5" SATA Hard Drive (Storage), display card - NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2060 6GB GDDR6, connectivity - 802.11ac Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, 2 x 2 ports - 1x HDMI.?

Title: George Brown College - Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management - Laptop Recommendations

George Brown College's Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management recommends the following laptop specifications for their program. Students are encouraged to have a laptop that meets or exceeds these requirements to ensure a smooth learning experience.

Laptop specifications:

Operating System: Windows 10 (64-bit) or macOS (latest version)
Processor: Intel i5 or AMD Ryzen 5 or equivalent
Memory: 8 GB RAM (minimum), 16 GB RAM (recommended)
Graphics Processing Unit (GPU): Integrated graphics (Intel HD Graphics 620 or NVIDIA GeForce 940MX or better) or dedicated GPU with 2GB VRAM (NVIDIA GTX 1050 or AMD Radeon RX 560 or better)
Storage: SSD (minimum 256 GB, recommended 512 GB or larger)
Wi-Fi and Bluetooth: 802.11ac, 2 x 2 ports
HDMI port: 1x HDMI 2.0
SuperSpeed USB ports: 3x SuperSpeed USB 3.1 Gen 1 Type-A, 1x with PowerShare
